column4: heres my situation: I have been testing out Ubuntu on an old box with a very small hard drive (4 gigs) after adding alot of the utilities I commonly use it became apparent I would need more space, so I tossed in another small drive (3 gigs). I figured I would just copy my /usr partition to the new drive, make an fstab entry and thats it..
yep.  Well, partition the new drive ext3, then copy the files, then fstab.  But yeah
unfortunately this doesnt seem to be working, even after setting up my /etc/fstab with the asnine UUID format
